author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Football Adds 10 On 1st Day Of Early Signing Period
text:
Football Adds 10 On 1st Day Of Early Signing Period
Texas Southern head football coach Cris Dishman has successfully signed 10 student-athletes during the opening day of the early signing period for the 2024-25 football season. The focus has been on strengthening the offensive line and defensive secondary, bringing in three offensive linemen, four defensive backs, and three wide receivers along with a placekicker. Recruiting Coordinator Jerwin Wilson emphasized the importance of these positions due to expected losses from graduation. Notably, several signings come from high school playoff teams and junior colleges with championship experience. The program aims to keep local talent close, signing eight players from Texas, five of whom are from Houston.
- 10 total student-athletes signed on the first day of the early signing period
- 8 recruits from Texas, 5 from the Houston area
- Texas Southern's recruitment strategy focuses on key player positions that are facing graduation losses.
- The program is leveraging local talent to build a stronger team foundation.
- Currently, commitments include players competing in ongoing playoffs and championships.
The program plans to expand its recruitment efforts through both signing periods, aiming to attract more athletes with competitive backgrounds. Continued evaluations will help refine their focus on both high school and junior college talents, enhancing overall team strength.
Bottom LineThis early signing class underscores Texas Southern's commitment to bolstering critical team areas while prioritizing local talent. This approach reflects a strategic blend of immediate needs and long-term team development.
Read more at Texas Southern University Athletics
